title: Base R data structures
text:
Creating pre and post vectors for blood pressure measurements

pre <- c (120, 151, 125, 126, 115, 132, 132, 129, 134, 139, 127, 122, 127, 135, 133, 128, 147, 138, 140, 132)

post <- c (127, 145, 135, 122, 115, 122, 123, 126, 126, 129, 132, 146, 120, 114, 121, 120, 128, 120, 133, 115)

Adding names to the vectors elements

subj <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
names(pre) <- subj
names(post) <- subj
names(pre)

 [1] "Subject_1"  "Subject_2"  "Subject_3"  "Subject_4"  "Subject_5" 
 [6] "Subject_6"  "Subject_7"  "Subject_8"  "Subject_9"  "Subject_10"
[11] "Subject_11" "Subject_12" "Subject_13" "Subject_14" "Subject_15"
[16] "Subject_16" "Subject_17" "Subject_18" "Subject_19" "Subject_20"

names(post)

 [1] "Subject_1"  "Subject_2"  "Subject_3"  "Subject_4"  "Subject_5" 
 [6] "Subject_6"  "Subject_7"  "Subject_8"  "Subject_9"  "Subject_10"
[11] "Subject_11" "Subject_12" "Subject_13" "Subject_14" "Subject_15"
[16] "Subject_16" "Subject_17" "Subject_18" "Subject_19" "Subject_20"


Calculating change in blood pressure

diff <- post - pre
diff

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
         7         -6         10         -4          0        -10         -9 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
        -3         -8        -10          5         24         -7        -21 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
       -12         -8        -19        -18         -7        -17 


Calculating average of difference in blood pressure

avg <- mean(diff)
avg

[1] -5.65


Patients having decrease in blood pressure after treatment

which(diff < 0)

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         2          4          6          7          8          9         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
        13         14         15         16         17         18         19 
Subject_20 
        20 


Subset of patients differences only return having positive change

posChange <- diff < 0
diffPosChange <- diff[posChange]
diffPosChange

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
        -6         -4        -10         -9         -3         -8        -10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
        -7        -21        -12         -8        -19        -18         -7 
Subject_20 
       -17 


Average decrease in blood pressure (positive change)

avgPosChange  <- mean (diffPosChange)
avgPosChange

[1] -10.6


Creating a data frame

bp_df <- data.frame(patient=subj, pre_bp=pre, post_bp=post, diff_bp=diff, row.names = NULL)
bp_df

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
1   Subject_1    120     127       7
2   Subject_2    151     145      -6
3   Subject_3    125     135      10
4   Subject_4    126     122      -4
5   Subject_5    115     115       0
6   Subject_6    132     122     -10
7   Subject_7    132     123      -9
8   Subject_8    129     126      -3
9   Subject_9    134     126      -8
10 Subject_10    139     129     -10
11 Subject_11    127     132       5
12 Subject_12    122     146      24
13 Subject_13    127     120      -7
14 Subject_14    135     114     -21
15 Subject_15    133     121     -12
16 Subject_16    128     120      -8
17 Subject_17    147     128     -19
18 Subject_18    138     120     -18
19 Subject_19    140     133      -7
20 Subject_20    132     115     -17


Getting the rows containing diff_bp column negative

bp_df[bp_df$diff_bp < 0,]

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
2   Subject_2    151     145      -6
4   Subject_4    126     122      -4
6   Subject_6    132     122     -10
7   Subject_7    132     123      -9
8   Subject_8    129     126      -3
9   Subject_9    134     126      -8
10 Subject_10    139     129     -10
13 Subject_13    127     120      -7
14 Subject_14    135     114     -21
15 Subject_15    133     121     -12
16 Subject_16    128     120      -8
17 Subject_17    147     128     -19
18 Subject_18    138     120     -18
19 Subject_19    140     133      -7
20 Subject_20    132     115     -17


Adding a new column to the data frame if

bp_df$low_bp <- (bp_df$post_bp < 120)
knitr::kable(bp_df)




patient
pre_bp
post_bp
diff_bp
low_bp

title: Base R data structures
text:
Creating pre and post vectors for blood pressure measurements

pre <- c (120, 151, 125, 126, 115, 132, 132, 129, 134, 139, 127, 122, 127, 135, 133, 128, 147, 138, 140, 132)

post <- c (127, 145, 135, 122, 115, 122, 123, 126, 126, 129, 132, 146, 120, 114, 121, 120, 128, 120, 133, 115)

Adding names to the vectors elements

subj <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
names(pre) <- subj
names(post) <- subj
names(pre)

 [1] "Subject_1"  "Subject_2"  "Subject_3"  "Subject_4"  "Subject_5" 
 [6] "Subject_6"  "Subject_7"  "Subject_8"  "Subject_9"  "Subject_10"
[11] "Subject_11" "Subject_12" "Subject_13" "Subject_14" "Subject_15"
[16] "Subject_16" "Subject_17" "Subject_18" "Subject_19" "Subject_20"

names(post)

 [1] "Subject_1"  "Subject_2"  "Subject_3"  "Subject_4"  "Subject_5" 
 [6] "Subject_6"  "Subject_7"  "Subject_8"  "Subject_9"  "Subject_10"
[11] "Subject_11" "Subject_12" "Subject_13" "Subject_14" "Subject_15"
[16] "Subject_16" "Subject_17" "Subject_18" "Subject_19" "Subject_20"


Calculating change in blood pressure

diff <- post - pre
diff

        -3         -8        -10          5         24         -7        -21 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
       -12         -8        -19        -18         -7        -17 


Calculating average of difference in blood pressure

avg

[1] -5.65


Patients having decrease in blood pressure after treatment

which(diff < 0)

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         2          4          6          7          8          9         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
        13         14         15         16         17         18         19 
Subject_20 
        20 


Subset of patients differences only return having positive change

posChange <- diff < 0
diffPosChange <- diff[posChange]
diffPosChange

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
        -6         -4        -10         -9         -3         -8        -10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
        -7        -21        -12         -8        -19        -18         -7 
Subject_20 
       -17 


Average decrease in blood pressure (positive change)

avgPosChange  <- mean (diffPosChange)
avgPosChange

[1] -10.6


Creating a data frame

bp_df <- data.frame(patient=subj, pre_bp=pre, post_bp=post, diff_bp=diff, row.names = NULL)
bp_df

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp

title: Base R data structures
text:
List
Creating a new data frame with placebo

pre_treat <- c (138, 135, 147, 117, 152, 134, 114, 121, 131, 130)
post_treat <- c(105, 136, 123, 130, 134, 143, 135, 139, 120, 124)
placebo_df <- data.frame(patient=subj[1:10], pre_bp=pre_treat, post_bp=post_treat, diff_bp=(post_treat-pre_treat),low_bp= (post_treat < 120), row.names = NULL)

Creating a list treatment and placebo

treat_list <- list(treatment=bp_df, placebo=placebo_df)

Accessing the list in different ways

treat_list[[1]]

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp low_bp
1   Subject_1    120     127       7  FALSE
2   Subject_2    151     145      -6  FALSE
3   Subject_3    125     135      10  FALSE
4   Subject_4    126     122      -4  FALSE
5   Subject_5    115     115       0   TRUE
6   Subject_6    132     122     -10  FALSE
7   Subject_7    132     123      -9  FALSE
8   Subject_8    129     126      -3  FALSE
9   Subject_9    134     126      -8  FALSE
10 Subject_10    139     129     -10  FALSE
11 Subject_11    127     132       5  FALSE
12 Subject_12    122     146      24  FALSE
13 Subject_13    127     120      -7  FALSE
14 Subject_14    135     114     -21   TRUE
15 Subject_15    133     121     -12  FALSE
16 Subject_16    128     120      -8  FALSE
17 Subject_17    147     128     -19  FALSE
18 Subject_18    138     120     -18  FALSE
19 Subject_19    140     133      -7  FALSE
20 Subject_20    132     115     -17   TRUE

treat_list$treatment

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp low_bp

10 Subject_10    139     129     -10  FALSE
11 Subject_11    127     132       5  FALSE
12 Subject_12    122     146      24  FALSE
13 Subject_13    127     120      -7  FALSE
14 Subject_14    135     114     -21   TRUE
15 Subject_15    133     121     -12  FALSE
16 Subject_16    128     120      -8  FALSE
17 Subject_17    147     128     -19  FALSE
18 Subject_18    138     120     -18  FALSE
19 Subject_19    140     133      -7  FALSE
20 Subject_20    132     115     -17   TRUE

treat_list[1]

$treatment
      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp low_bp

2   Subject_2    151     145      -6  FALSE

Access pre_bp of placebo data frame

treat_list$placebo$pre_bp

 [1] 138 135 147 117 152 134 114 121 131 130
